text: Azura was the third daughter of Adam and Eve in the Abrahamic religions. Azura was also the sister-wife of Seth. The sibcestual relationship between Azura and Seth was the first of Adam and Eve's children which did not involve a twincestual pairing.Amaru, Betsy Halpern. "The First Woman, Wives, and Mothers in" Jubilees"." Journal of Biblical literature 113.4 (1994): 609-626. She is not mentioned in the writings that are considered the Bible for most Jews and Christians, but she is mentioned in the Book of Jubilees. ==References== Category:Abrahamic religions
title: Azura
